summary:
Level 1 Dark Elf Savegame - right after your Escape from Helgen...
(I have grabbed all valueable and useful things inside!) + included a full forsworn armor set for Kisara
see the file description for NEEDED mods and where to download them
descriptionHtml:
[img]http://i1152.photobucket.com/albums/p483/8383Willow/Kisara1.jpg[/img]
[size=4]a beautiful female DarkElf/Dunmer[/size]


[img]http://i1152.photobucket.com/albums/p483/8383Willow/Feedback_blue.jpg[/img]
. . . (comments, uploaded images, constructive critizism, . . .)

Level 1 Dark Elf Savegame - saved right after your Escape from Helgen (I have grabbed all valueable and useful things inside!)
+ included a full forsworn armor set for Kisara - it looks really nice on her
(the headdress has the default texture - you still need to download the PURPLE-Real Dreadlocks Retexture!) ;)
(If you don't like to "cheat" just drop the 4 forsworn items!)



Official HD DLC Pack Compatibility - Step by Step Guide
If you are using the official HD_Texture_Pack you have to follow this little guide to make it compatible with my Savegame
(because the used Texture-Mods would not show up otherwise)! Dont worry - it is really simple and safe - just follow the 4 steps:

1. Go to your Skyrim.ini, usually located in Documents/My Games/Skyrim. Make a backup!
2. In the Skryim.ini find the section called [Archive], and add the information for the HiResTexturePack.bsa files so that it looks exactly like this:

[Archive]
sResourceArchiveList=Skyrim - Misc.bsa, Skyrim - Shaders.bsa, Skyrim - Textures.bsa, HighResTexturePack01.bsa, HighResTexturePack02.bsa, Skyrim - Interface.bsa, Skyrim - Animations.bsa, Skyrim - Meshes.bsa, Skyrim - Sounds.bsa
sResourceArchiveList2=Skyrim - Voices.bsa, Skyrim - VoicesExtra.bsa

3. Save the .ini with the new settings
4. Disable/Delete HiResTexturePack01.esp and HiResTexturePack02.esp
You don't need them anymore to run the dlc-textures because of the above .ini changes.


[img]http://i1152.photobucket.com/albums/p483/8383Willow/Kisara_Mods.jpg[/img]
to get her look - like shown in my preview images:

>>> HAIR: REAL DREADLOCKS (Forsworn Headdress Retexture) - my own mod to improve the look of the female forsworn headdress
Download the PURPLE Retexture (included in the NONREPLACING-ALL-in-ONE package) here: [url=http://www.skyrimnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=5865]sexy Real Dreadlocks[/url]

>>> Face-Skintone: [url=http://www.skyrimnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=3563]Coverwomen[/url] choose a natural version (I recommend look 3)

>>> Body-Skintone: [url=http://www.skyrimnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=18]No Dirty Bodies[/url] for her skin - best matching skintone for the "coverwomen"-face retexture

>>> Eyes: [url=http://www.skyrimnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=4869]Covereyes[/url] to get her amazing purple-pink eyes!


[img]http://i1152.photobucket.com/albums/p483/8383Willow/Kisara_ingame.jpg[/img]
If you want to change Kisara's look (Hairstyle, Haircolor, Warpaint, Eyecolor, NAME...)
ingame you have to use the game console (its really easy!):


1. to open the console use the tilde-key (~) (left side - above TAB)

2. type in: showracemenu

3. klick the tilde-key again to close the console

4. now you can change her to you likings in the character menu
(just like you would with a normal new character at the beginning of the game)

5. press R when you are done - and give her a name (Kisara or whatever you like!) - press enter!
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Enjoy Skyrim with your new dunmer dragonborn!


Thanks for downloading!
Please leave a comment if you enjoyed playing with Kisara
(You can also upload an image of your adventures with her!)

:)


Credits:
To all Modders which created the beautiful mods I used in this savegame!
Bethesda - for another great game!
